Instructor: Elizabeth Lin

E-mail: drlinelizabeth76@yahoo.com

 **_English II (for Non-English Majors)_**

Spring, 2018

**About this course:**

If you want to succeed in this class you need to be willing to devote time each day for additional reading. You will also need to arrive to class prepared to participate. Group discussion is essential in class. Please do everything that takes to prepare yourself for it. Once you do so, you will be able to find that the whole language learning is fun and exciting.

**Textbook**

Paul Dummet, Helen Stephenson, Lewis Lansford. (2017). _Keynote 3._ National Geographic Learning.

**Requirements and Rules**

1.     The success of this class is based on your active involvement in the classroom. Attendance is required. Missing 3 classes, for any reason, when attendance is taken, results in an automatic F (0) for the class.

2.     When you are in the classroom you are to be working with the entire class (your teacher and your classmates) on class related material.

3.     I will post reading articles regularly on Facebook. Please make sure you have your own Facebook account. All handouts are on FB. You may have to print them out when required (i.e. Peer Evaluation form, Oral Presentation Form, Book Summary Report, etc…)

4.     Textbook is a must. Violation of this rule will cost you 3 points (out of your final score) each time.

5.     You are not supposed to use your electronic toys such as smart phone, laptop, iPad, or iPod in class. Violation of this rule will cost you 3 points each time.

6.     Plagiarism or Cheating on quizzes or exams is absolutely forbidden. If someone is found cheating on an exam, he/she will fail that exam.

7.     No food allowed during class meeting.

**8.**     **English ONLY. NO Chinese!!!**

9.     For every English (I) class has been arranged an hour to take **Lexile** online reading comprehension test during 10/8 to 10/19. You can check out **Lexile levelled books** (Scholastic Inc.) from **NTNU library** according to your own Lexile level (from 0L~1800L). Don’t forget to return the books to the library afterwards. At the end of the semester you will write a book summary on what you have read this semester and do an oral report to the entire class.

10.  For this semester you will share with the class something you know very well in a 3-minute oral presentation. Topic of your own choice. English ONLY, please! For more detailed information, please check this website: [https://ntnuengcompetition.weebly.com/320998379122843635611-3-minute-presentation.html](https://ntnuengcompetition.weebly.com/320998379122843635611-3-minute-presentation.html)

**Grading Policies**

1.     Group Presentation  30% (Vocab List 10% + PPT 10% +Oral 10%)

2.     3 Minute Presentation  10% (PPT 5% + Oral 5%)

3.     Extended Reading Project 20% (Written 10% + Oral PPT 10%)

4.     Final Exam  30%

5.     Attendance/In class participation 10%
